pageContext.claim: “We're not going to manufacture anymore. Previous administrations. You'd need a magic wand to bring... Well, we did -- 32,000 last month, we got manufacturing jobs alone.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. added 26,000 manufacturing jobs in October. Plus, Trump is misquoting Obama. The former president said in a June 2016 town hall, that "you're actually seeing some manufacturers coming back to the United States" but that alone won't help workers whose jobs had been previously outsourced and so "what we have to do is to make sure that folks are trained for the jobs that are coming in now." The "magic wand" referred to recreating jobs of the past through negotiating "a better deal."
